result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ptc sheet requesting warrant with cash alternative.
Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed by Atty Anne Renc

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:18 PM Defendant Theresa L Shaw in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Theresa L Shaw. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact and do not go onto the premises of any of the Metro Markets in Portage County.

1:29 PM Defendant Theresa Lynn Shaw appeared by video, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner is present in court.
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping and Retail Theft. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
